This cycle we’re emphasizing three things most:
1) Sustained academic rigor (strong fundamentals plus evidence you seek challenge—advanced coursework, enrichment, or self-driven study).
2) Initiative with follow-through (starting or improving something and sticking with it long enough to show impact).
3) Community contribution and fit (how you collaborate, support peers, and add to school life in a consistent way—not just one-off leadership titles).

Programs/areas we’re especially looking to strengthen this year:
- Academic mentoring/tutoring and peer-led study groups (students who can both excel and help others grow).
- Research/project-based learning culture (students who like to build, test, and present work—science, humanities, or interdisciplinary).
- Debate/communication and student-led service initiatives with measurable outcomes.

If you’re considering a formal application, two quick questions so I can advise you well:
- Which 1–2 areas would you most want to contribute to here (e.g., mentoring, clubs, research/projects, arts, service), and what’s one example of sustained commitment you’ve had?

conversation.message:

Academics & support: we pair rigorous core classes with structured support. Students have regular check-ins with an advisor, access to teacher office hours/tutoring, and we monitor progress early so we can step in quickly (study planning, skill workshops, and targeted help in key subjects).

Clubs are student-led with faculty sponsors, and it’s common for students to start new clubs if they have a clear plan and commitment.
